definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: He thrust all the responsibility on me.
sentences.chinese: 他把全部责任硬推给我。

sentences.english: Push it down hard with your foot several times.
sentences.chinese: 硬推下来，与你的脚好几次。

sentences.english: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不要把后天要做的事硬推到明天去做。

definition: to drag sb along against his will/to draw a forced analogy
to drag (sb) along (to a place)/to yank
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast
pinyin: bu4 guan3 san1 qi1 er4 shi2 yi1

definition: to pressure/to press/to force/to compel/to push/to coerce/to urge/to impel/to bully into/to be compelled
firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action
to be unable to bear or support
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
to fall flat on one's face/(martial arts) pouncing and falling (i.e. all kinds of moves)
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
